comments.author: Summer
comments.content: I agree, free trade is important. I lived in Ecuador for a while, had friends that grew coffee. It's REALLY hard work. The average worker got three dollars a day. It would be nice if free trade was a reality everywhere. And it would be nice if I won the giveaway. :)

comments.author: Mariah
comments.content: Already on the list and really glad you're supporting Fair Trade month. I lived in Sierra Leone for some time, near coffee farms that were not covered under fair trade agreements. The wages were often under a dollar a day. I now try to set aside the extra dollar or two it costs to upgrade my chocolate and coffee to fair trade.

comments.author: bonnie
comments.content: I'm already on the list, and I applaud your support of Fair Trade.  I once spent time with Caribbean coffee farmers, and it was shocking to learn about how market pressures and exploitative lending practices worked to keep them from ever getting ahead (until they formed a cooperative and learned to work together to benefit their communities).

Thanks for sharing.

comments.author: Cindy Myers
comments.content: I love that society is waking up to the ethics and morality of being a consumer. Who you give your money to is an important message of support.
